intro: Pimelea venosa, commonly known as the silky pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Pimelea venosa is often found in coastal regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
